part.narration: The music of Suntory Hall echoes into silence.NoLifeQueen and Yuki are one. They share the same face. They share the same pain. Some brilliant process of a digital image caught all the girl's emotion. Is the computer smart, or the lady vain—
part.line: Wake up!
Huh?
Some new player managed to find this cycle's root directory.
The corrupt data and rogue glitch before you is the result
of brute-forcing the root password with an army of cheap rigs with bad RAM.
I'd teach the thrifty cracker a lesson, but I don't want to break my computer.
part.narration: The water stands still, while the sand ripples. Droplets of ocean float from ground to air. Clouds drop from the sky. Player characters, unable to assist the Internet Police, walk on their hairs and think on their toes.A dialogue box flashes for a split second.
part.line: Not it!
Not it!
Shoot.
There are no Clans here. We'll cover you, Yukes!
part.narration: NoLifeQueen and company make their way across the shards of broken data. Guns are shooting guns. Humans are walking upside down. Random objects are disappearing. Someone picks up a gun and it turns into a player from another zone.
NoLifeQueen makes it into the castle at the end of the beach. Yuki sighs.
part.line: Why did dad have to design the game like this?
part.narration: A strong, courageous, talent-fostering man appears from behind a pillar. He is dressed in a jogging-suit. He runs around the castle, commanding a multitude of corrupt adding-machines.
part.line: Because he appointed a prince.
Yuki, if we destroy the current configuration files, the game will recycle.
This world can be shaped to our desires.
You know nothing of this world, JJ.
Dad wouldn't want men who desire control to ruin The Clan's chaos.
Is the desire for discord not a form of concord?
Dad saw me in the hall.
He told me, "I expected Yuki."
Well, when I saw you, I expected you.
Live your life, not your father's.
Now get the hell out of my game.
No.
What the hell, you just slapped your sister!
In a video game!
Don't you get it? It doesn't matter! Video games don't matter!
I'd shoot you if it meant I'd win!
What of the intent?
I'll show you intent!
We've disappointed our own parents, Yuki —
We've disappointed the ones who gave us the privilege of living!
part.narration: NoLifeKing knocks a pillar over. The moment it hits the ground, it transforms into a helicopter. Because the fortress is corrupt, this presents a multitude of unforseen opportunities to the opponent... and the Player. The pillars turn into vehicles when someone hits them. The vehicles explode seconds after boarding them. The ground type changes when something explodes on them. Water causes things to bounce. Solid ground submerges things. You know the drill, freak the Player out.The game is afoot.
NoLifeKing is taking quite the beating. His hit-point counter nears zero. Yuki gloats.
part.line: Is blindly following a distorted vision of your inheritance called "living?"
part.narration: Just before defeat, NoLifeKing presses a button. A laser beam defeats NoLifeQueen. Game Over. JJ sniffles. NoLifeKing rises.
part.line: It's called succession.
